events.comment: The player's score as a global variable.
The number of rockets the player can fire.

event-group.description: The player control, UI display and general events
event-group.title: Player and general

sub-events.comment: Play a startup sound, then start the game music. Remove the initial gun flare object.
On startup, also set the jet loop sound playing and looping, but fade it out if the player is not moving.
Animate the player. Switch to the tilt animations on pressing the arrow keys. Set the animation speed based on the movement speed, so the rotating barrel speeds up as you move.
Prevent the player flying ahead too far or going off the bottom of the screen.
Fire lasers 10 times a second while space is down.
Don't let player bullets carry on all the way up the layout - destroy them when they reach the top of the screen.
Scroll to the scroller object, keep the gun flares in place, and keep the display updated.
If pressing shift and no rockets available, play a bloop sound.
If pressing shift and rockets available, spawn two rockets either side of the player.

event-group.description: The spinning blade enemy which occasionally fires at the player.
event-group.title: BladeEnemy

sub-events.comment: When blade enemies hit, reduce their health. Rockets destroy them completely on impact.
When blade enemies run out of health, destroy them.
Make blade enemies gradually rotate towards the player.
If the blade enemy has gone off the bottom of the screen, destroy it.
While there are BladeEnemies, pick a random one and make it shoot at the player every 1 second.
When the enemy bullets hit the player, cause some damage.
If the blade enemy collides with the player, make it explode and cause the player damage.

event-group.description: The green bomb enemy that doesn't shoot.
event-group.title: SpikeyEnemy

sub-events.comment: Spikey enemies are one-hit kills. Rockets don't even explode when hitting a spikey enemy, let them pass straight through.
SpikeyEnemies are like bombs, so cause lots of damage if they hit the player.

event-group.description: Moves down the screen and shoots at the player.
event-group.title: BugEnemy

sub-events.comment: Cause damage when the player shoots the bug enemy. Rockets destroy bug enemies on impact.
Destroy the bug enemy when it runs out of health.
Make the bug enemies move down the screen at 100 pixels per second.
Destroy bug enemies if they go off the bottom of the screen.
While there are BugEnemies, pick a random one and make it shoot a salvo of three shots at the player, each 200ms apart.
If the bug's lasers hit the player, cause them damage.
As with the other enemies, if the bug enemy hits the player, explode and cause the player damage.

event-group.description: Moves in a figure-8 pattern horizontally firing lasers down and occasionally firing a SpikeyEnemy at the player.
event-group.title: FighterEnemy

sub-events.comment: When fighter enemies hit, reduce their health. Rockets don't destroy on impact, just cause 10 damage.
When fighter enemies run out of health, destroy them.
On creation (when the 'created' instance variable is at its default, 0) store the position of the object in the originX and originY instance variables.
Move the fighter enemy in a horizontal figure-8 pattern using its own timer stored in an instance variable.
Destroy fighter enemies if they go off the bottom of the screen.
While there are fighter enemies, make them shoot straight down (not at the player) every second.
If the fighter enemy collides with the player, make it explode and cause the player damage.
Destroy the player if they run out of health!

action.param: "I just scored " & Score & " playing Space Blaster!"

event-group.description: Turning the hidden 'EnemySpawner' object in to groups of enemies.
event-group.title: Enemy spawning

sub-events.comment: When the hidden enemy spawner objects get near the visible screen, depending on their 'type' instance variable, spawn a bunch of enemies.
When the 'type' instance variable is "4Blades", create four BladeEnemies.
When the 'type' instance variable is "9Spikey", create nine SpikeyEnemies.
And so on for other enemy types...
Don't forget to destroy the enemy spawner, or it will keep spawning enemies.
Player collecting a rocket powerup.
Destroy rocket powerups if they go too far off the bottom of the screen.
This event is intentionally empty, it simply stops the browser scrolling down when you press spacebar (Construct 2 prevents browser shortcuts if any key press event exists for it).
Explosions need to be destroyed when their animation is over, otherwise they would still exist on their last frame, gradually slowing down the game.
